name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Boston - Downtown

reviews.text: This hotel has a huge disadvantage if you have luggage: the lobby is one level up from the street and there is just a small, slow elevator to manage local (lobby) and room level traffic. This is quite inconvenient on check-in and check-out.
reviews.title: Great location but very average

reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed that being a Silver HH member, I was not told that I had a smoking room/floor, even though my profile is quite clear about my preferences, and only found out the next morning when the room stank of smoke. By then I was in full conference delegate mode with early morning meetings and evening events, so I had no time to bother changing rooms. I resorted to putting towels to block smoke seeping into the room, even the AC was not enough to manage the smell.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with any smoking room/floor, this detracts from feeling that the room is clean.
reviews.title: Great Theater District Location

reviews.text: Other than that, the location is great, you can basically walk everywhere in central Boston, including the Convention Center (OK you have to like walking), and lots of shopping restaurants nearby. It's not the nicest setting since it is at the edge of the nicer areas (Chinatown/Tufts Medical Center) but felt totally safe.
reviews.title: could be better

reviews.text: I don't think I'll be back here though.
reviews.title: It was OKAY

reviews.text: Hotel was old and while remodeled, $270 a night for a mediocre, nothing-special room is a lot. Room nowhere quality of a luxury hotel. If it was $100 less than I guess it would be ok... But it wasn't. Breakfast buffet was outrageously pricey. One and done. Also, bus to convention. Center required trek to adjacent street via parking lot. Would stay elsewhere next time.
reviews.title: Pricey but maybe that's just Boston

reviews.text: They say that if yoi stay in Doubletree, you will get complimentary cookies upon arrival. But I didn't! I guess one has to ask. Nonetheless, it was a pretty nice hotel very near to a lot of tourist spots. I love their toiletries, its crabtree and evelyn. Their complimentary room coffee is wolfgang puck estate grown coffee, limited to 2 packs per night.
reviews.title: Missed my chocolate chip cookie

reviews.text: Very good location in the Theater and Chinatown district. Walking distance to everything. I was staying in a newly renovated room which was a "test" to see if this should be the new Doubletree standard. Add a couple of power sockets and this is very good.
reviews.title: Good location - newly renovated room.

reviews.text: Breakfast included was not impressive at all, add USD. 5,- to get egg/bacon and so on.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel, good location

reviews.text: Doubletree is a simple, affordable and a hotel very near the train station. Hence, it is very accessible to commute and transport to other places. It is also located near Chinatown--lots of good and inexpensive restaurants to choose from. The hotel rooms are clean and spacious. The only downside to the hotel is that there is no free access to the Internet in the room.
reviews.title: Solid hotel

reviews.text: We took our 19 year old daughter with us for a mini vacation to Boston before she moves away for an 18 month period. We used my Hilton points, but wanted something in the heart of Boston.
reviews.title: Mini vacation in Boston

reviews.text: Our GPS took us from the Logan Airport through a very sketchy part of town and upon arrival my wife and daughter were thinking we chose the wrong hotel. However, at check in, the hotel representative showed us a map and all the attractions around the hotel and we decided to stay. My advise, don't let the GPS guide you, this hotel was great and in a perfect part of town for us. Honestly, it does not come across as a great hotel on first impressions, but it is very nice inside and the location is great if you want Boston Commons and other historical sites. We are very happy we stayed.
reviews.title: Dirty and overpriced

reviews.text: Boston Commons is only about a 10 minute walk, and that's the beginning of the Freedom Trail, so the history starts literally right out your door. The hotel is in China town, or right on the outskirts, which is another area our daughter wanted to visit. All in all the location was great for us. If your there for business, I imagine it depends on how and where you need to go, but for the tourist this really worked well for us. It was close enough to Beacon Hill, Little Italy, and even the Back Bay area for us to walk, but taking the subway or trolley works well too. We had a car, I would recommend against this, unless you want to spend a ton of money. we needed to get into further away areas, so the car was needed, but the cost is about $50 a night to park at the hotel, that's the most I've ever paid for car parking at a hotel. Parking in the city is just as expensive, once again I would recommend other means of travel, but it's up to you.
reviews.title: Double Tree on Washington Street Boston

reviews.text: The rooms were fine, nothing great, but certainly up to any Double Tree standards. The morning buffet was small, but we only eat the continental breakfast and it was fine for us.
reviews.title: Must have had a straight decorator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was very good, I have no complaints.
reviews.title: Convenient location...pricey but average for Boston

reviews.text: I tried the Doubletree because I normally stay in Hilton Financial District and I wanted something new. I think the Hilton Financial is a bit too 'traditional' and not very modern. I had good experiences with Doubletree elsewhere (London, Amsterdam, Philadelphia's Doubletree is awesome, and North Miami as well). The Boston Downtown Doubletree turned out to be a bit disappointing. Very dark rooms and not much style. Staff are a bit distant as well. The bar is OK with lots of couches and stools so plenty of room. Also easy to graba drink or some food. The rooms are really disappointing. they should redo them.
reviews.title: Pretty average. Bit run down, but Ok

reviews.text: We (myself, my wife and 16-/13-yo sons) stayed this hotel in June 2013 for 4 nights. Our room was #548 and the only thing we could see from the window was the huge building of Tufts Medical Center... but other than that, it was an excellent stay and we enjoyed a lot.
reviews.title: If you like Chinese/Vietnamese foods, this would be the best hotel in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As other reviewers mention, Tufts Medical Center "T" station is very close. Note that while "Orange Line" is a subway and "Silver Line" is actually a bus. I strongly recommend you to buy a 7-day pass ($18).
reviews.title: Some rooms are located across a night club parking lot

reviews.text: It is in the middle of Chinatown and many of restaurants (Chinese and Vietnamese) were inexpensive. We bought Vietnamese sandwiches there and walked to Boston Common for breakfast.
reviews.title: The Silver Lining...

reviews.text: The closest drug store I could find was the CVS Pharmacy at Chinatown "T" station. I bought a pack of bottled water there. A bottle of water at hotel costs $2.
reviews.title: Convenient
